page.title: 13LEGENDS AND SUPERSTITIONS
page.content: {Bella in the wych-elm { { }In April 1943, 4 boys went birdwatching in Hagley woods. They noticed a large wych-elm, looked in, and were alarmed to find a{skull {grinning}back at them. Upon more detailed investigation, the local police found it to be the decomposed body of a 35 year old woman. She had been murdered and her mouth had been stuffed with cotton wool to prevent her telling her tale. Although a shoe and ring were later found nearby, her identity was never discovered - hence her nickname of "Bella." {Cut Throat Lane { } A 14 year old girl, finding herself to be{pregnant,}was said to have committed suicide by cutting her own throat. Her ghost supposedly haunts the lane.
